messages.title: What the NHS Long-Term Plan Means for You and Your Family...
messages.content: Boris Johnson announces £1.8 billion cash boost for the NHS. Primary care to receive £4.5bn under the NHS long-term plan. NHS long-term plan: Focus on prevention 'could save 500,000 lives'. Major overhaul of birthing services to make ‘NHS best place in the world to give birth’. The NHS Long-Term Plan is a welcome and significant step in the fight against heart and circulatory diseases, which promises to save thousands of lives in the coming years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Boris Johnson announces £1.8 billion cash boost for the NHS. Focus on prevention could save 500,000 lives. Major overhaul of birthing services.

issues.brexitEurope: Brexit has taken up too much time.
issues.education: And by getting Brexit done we can keep focusing on the priorities we all share. That means delivering on the people’s priorities: safer streets, better hospitals, more funding for schools.
issues.health: Boris Johnson announces £1.8 billion cash boost for the NHS. NHS long-term plan: Focus on prevention 'could save 500,000 lives'. Major overhaul of birthing services to make ‘NHS best place in the world to give birth’. Billions of pounds extra for our NHS. More money for mental health services. New treatments to fight diseases like cancer. More doctors, nurses and health professionals. New technology and better prevention. Tackling waste to spend every pound wisely.

community.content: Develop new treatments and cure for patients using new medicines and technology. Invest in world-class hospitals. Easier access to GP appointments. Better links between NHS and social care services.

leaflet.personalStatement: The NHS is part of our heritage. It's a statement of who we are as a country. We believe that everyone has the right to great healthcare that’s free at the point of use – no matter where they live or what their background.

endorsements.endorsement: these plans demonstrate a clear commitment to mental health through increased spending and introducing access standards.
The NHS Long-Term Plan is a welcome and significant step in the fight against heart and circulatory diseases, which promises to save thousands of lives in the coming years.
